overview: This subject examines the principal components of Australian consumer law. Seminars 1 and 2 survey the relevant law and consider the purpose and policy issues associated with protecting consumers. Seminars 3-18 then cover the protections created by the Australian Consumer Law (ACL) and what consumers can do to take advantage of those protections. Seminars 19 and 20 cover the enforcement of those protections and the remedies available to consumers in cases of non-compliance. Consumer Law has a practical orientation, designed to assist consumers to know, understand and pursue their rights.
